meanings.sent2: Animals reproduce to continue their species.
meanings.sent3: The baby birds learned to reproduce their parents' chirping.
meanings.sent4: The farm seemed to reproduce new life every spring.
meanings.sent5: In the forest, the cycle of reproduction was a beautiful sight.

meanings.sent1: The photocopier can reproduce documents easily.
meanings.sent2: Artists often reproduce their paintings for sale.
meanings.sent3: The machine could reproduce the same image over and over.
meanings.sent4: The printer was able to reproduce the exact colors of the original.
meanings.sent5: The technology allowed them to reproduce the design flawlessly.

meanings.definition: To recreate or bring about again
meanings.sent1: The play aimed to reproduce the magic of the original performance.
meanings.sent2: Historians try to reproduce the events of the past accurately.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to reproduce the taste of his grandmother's famous pie.
meanings.sent4: The artist wanted to reproduce the feeling of nostalgia in his painting.
meanings.sent5: The team worked hard to reproduce the success of their first project.
